content.question: Which of the following claims best characterizes the emergence of African American Studies?

choices.label: The push for African American Studies programs on college campuses focused on including Black Studies in American history courses when appropriate.
The emergence of African American Studies created opportunities to incorporate mainstream views of history into the discipline.
The movement for African American Studies created new opportunities to open colleges dedicated to studying marginalized groups.
The development of African American Studies was a process that involved artistic, intellectual, and political endeavors to document Black experiences and contributions.

content.answer: The development of African American Studies was a process that involved artistic, intellectual, and political endeavors to document Black experiences and contributions.

skill.text: 3.B: Support a claim or argument using specific and relevant evidence.
